description:
Biography

Natalie Portman was born in Jerusalem. She started acting from a young age. She first appeared in the movie Leon at the age of 13. She was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for Closer and won the Academy Award for Best Actress for Black Swan.

Acting Profile

Generally known for her independent or artistic roles, Natalie Portman is regarded as one of the finest actresses of her generation. She thrives on character driven roles.

Comic Related Movie Roles

She has played Queen Amidala/Padme in the Star Wars Prequel Trilogy, Evey Hammond in V for Vendetta and Jane Foster in the Thor movie franchise; Thor and Thor: The Dark World. She has also been featured as a guest voice on the Simpsons.

deck: British actor most famous for his role as Star Trek: The Next Generation's Captain Jean-Luc Picard.
description:
Biography

Sir Patrick Stewart was born in Mirfield, Yorshire, England and began theater acting at a young age. He went on to become a Shakespearean stage actor before landing the role as Captain Jean-Luc Picard in TV's Star Trek: The Next Generation, gaining him nearly instant fame.

He remains to be an established actor on film and in theater, as well as a voice actor. For his achievements, he was knighted by the Queen of England in 2010.

Acting Profile

Trained in England as a Shakespearean actor, Patrick Stewart broke into mainstream North American culture through his portrayal of Captain Picard in Star Trek. He continues to portray primarily serious roles.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Jean-Luc Picard

His most famous role, Sir Patrick was cast as the Captain of the USS Enterprise in the TV show Star Trek: The Next Generation in 1987. He appeared in all 176 episodes throughout 7 seasons, as well as the full length movies.

Professor X

Sir Patrick was cast as the founder of the X-Men in 2000, Professor Charles Xavier. It is generally regarded as a "dream cast" by the fans, Stewart being a near perfect fit for the character. He reprises the role in 2003's X2 and in 2006's X-Men: The Last Stand, as well as providing the voice in numerous X-Men related video games. He also had a shorter, cameo role in X-Men Origins: Wolverine and is expected to appear in the upcoming film X-Men: Days of Future Past.
name: Patrick Stewart

deck: Actor and author most known for his portrayal of Sulu on the original Star Trek
description:
Biography

George began his acting career in the 1950's, doing voice over work before landing supporting roles in television. After reaching fame on Star Trek, he continues to work in television and voice work on cartoons and video games.

George still plays a big role in conventions and is a gay rights activist.

George has also appeared in a few comics himself - see George Takei character page.

Comic Related Roles

Sulu

His most famous role, George played helmsman Hikaru Sulu in Star Trek: The Original Series. He also appeared in all six Star Trek movies, as well as an episode of Star Trek: Voyager.

Wong

George provided the voice for Wong, the assistant of Dr. Strange in the 1994 Spider-Man: The Animated Series.

Mr. Fixx

George provides the voice for Mr. Fixx, Derek Powers henchman and killer of Terry McGinnis' father in Batman Beyond.

Kaito Nakamura

George played Kaito Nakamura on the television show Heroes, the father of superpowered Hiro Nakamura.

Alpha Trion

George provided the voice of Alpha Trion in 2012's Transformers Prime cartoon series.

Galactus

George provides the voice of Galactus on The Super Hero Squad cartoon show.
name: George Takei

deck: A Northern Irish actor famous for multiple movie roles.
description:
Comic Related Movie Roles

Henri Ducard/Ra's al Ghul

In Christopher Nolan's film Batman Begins, Neeson played the role of one of Batman's two main antagonists of the film, Ra's al Ghul.

Ra's al Ghul was initially introduced to Bruce Wayne as Henri Ducard, and trained Bruce in the ways of the League of Shadows, teaching him the skills necessary to become Gotham's dark knight-- the Batman. He later revealed his true identity when he came to "cleanse" Gotham of its decadence.

Although his character died, he returned in the third installment of the Dark Knight trilogy - The Dark Knight Rises - as a figment of Batman's imagination.
name: Liam Neeson

description:
Biography

Famke began modeling for Chanel at the age of eighteen. She studied acting and literature before becoming an actress.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Starred as Jean Grey in X-Men, X2, and X-Men: The Last Stand. She later reprised the role in 2013's The Wolverine.

She also played the villainous Xenia Onatopp, who used sex to kill people, in GoldenEye.
name: Famke Jannsen

deck: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is a professional wrestler turned actor.
description:
Comic Related Roles

Roadblock

Johnson played the lead role of Roadblock in the Jon M. Chu-directed film G.I. Joe: Retaliation.

Hercules

Johnson played Hercules in the 2014 film Hercules. The film was loosely based on the late Steve Moore's series Hercules: The Thracian Wars.

Black Adam

In September of 2014, after several months of teasing his involvement in a DC Comics-based film, Johnson at long last revealed that he will be playing Shazam villain Black Adam. The film, titled Shazam, is set for a 2019 release through Warner Bros. subsidiary New Line Cinema.

Doc Savage

In May of 2016, Johnson announced via Instagram that he would be taking on the role of Doc Savage in the Shane Black written and directed project. There is no release date set at this time.
name: Dwayne Johnson

deck: A Japanese actor who has worked on various Toho movies. He is best known for his role in King Kong Escapes.
description:
Biography

Hideyo Amamato was born in Japan in 1926(he later on used the pseudonym Eisei Amamato). His older sister introduced him to friends who were in the acting field, to help Hideyo with his nihilism. These friends later encouraged him to be an actor. He later on landed a place in the Hayuza group of stage actors, where he was spotted by director Keisuke Kinoshita who hired him for the movie Twenty-Four Eyes(1954). Since then he joined Toho Studios where he has starred in numerous movies by them.

Comic Related Roles

Ghidorah, The Three Headed Monster- Wu, Butler

Ebirah Horror of the Deep- Red Bamboo Naval Officer

King Kong Escapes- Dr. Who

All Monsters Attack- Shinpei Inami, Toy Maker

Godzilla, Mothra, and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All Out Attack- Hirotoshi Isayama, Prophet
name: Hideyo (Eisei) Amamato

deck: Actress.
description:
Biography

An American actress, Scarlett Johansson was born in New York as the elder of twins. Initially a stage performer, she made her film debut at age 14 in the Elijah Wood movie North. She got a star on the Walk of Fame on May 2, 2012.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Rebecca Doppelmeyer

Scarlett Johansson's first role in a comic book film was in 2001, where she played Rebecca Doppelmeyer in the film adaptation of Daniel Clowes' Ghost World. The film was well received by critics, and nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay at the 74th Academy Awards.

Silken Floss

In 2008, Johansson starred alongside Samuel L. Jackson in the Frank Miller-directed film, The Spirit, which is based on the Will Eisner series of the same name. She played the villainous Silken Floss, an accomplice of the Octopus.

Black Widow/Natasha Romanoff

Johansson is likely best known for her role as Natasha Romanoff in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. She first played Romanoff in 2010's Iron Man 2, which was also the character's first appearance on the big screen.

She has since reprised her role in the following films:

  • The Avengers (2012)
  • Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014)
  • Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
  • Captain America: Civil War (2016)

Awards

deck: English actress.
description:
Comic Related Movie Roles

Sabé

In 1999, Keira played the role of Queen Amidala's servant in Star Wars: Episode One - The Phantom Menace. As Sabé, Keira donned the queen's wardrobe as a decoy. The ploy worked on both the movie characters and film-goers due to Keira's likeness to the actor portraying Queen Amidala, Natalie Portman.
name: Keira Knightley

deck: Jessica Alba is an actress who has played characters in adaptations of the Fantastic Four and Sin City
description:
Biography

Jessica Alba began her acting career at 13, her big break coming as the lead role in the television series Dark Angel. She also has worked in movies as well as modeling.

Comic Related Roles

Nancy Callahan

Jessica portrayed Nancy Callahan in the 2005 film adaptation of Sin City.

Invisible Woman

Jessica played Sue Storm, aka the Invisible Woman, in the film adaptations of the Fantastic Four. She appeared in 2005's Fantastic Four and the sequel Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer in 2007.
name: Jessica Alba

deck: Kenneth G. Murray is most known for his extensive DC reprint of comics. The Australian reprints of American comic books published between 1950s-1980s have become very popular items with modern-day collectors. He's most noted for reprints on characters such as Superman, Batman, Green Lantern, and more JLA members.
description: Kenneth G. Murray aka K.G. Murray is most known for its extensive DC reprint comics. Murray published his first magazine, "The Quality Man" in 1836, forming a publishing empire that dominated the Australian industry for decades. K.G.'s first comics in 1946 were original Australian work, but soon reprint material from the U.S dominated. The organization was initially composed of a range of jointly owned companies such as Man Magazine Pty Ltd, Cavalcade Magazine Pty Ltd, and Australian House and Garden Magazine Pty Ltd. with comics primarily published by Colour Comics Pty Ltd. In 1951, all shares in the companies were acquired by Publishers Holdings Ltd, a name that never appears in the comics. On February 1, 1972, Kenneth Murray retired as Managing Director while remaining on the board until 1974. On June 30, 1973, Australian Consolidated Press Ltd completed an acquisition and took control of the company. ACP continued producing comics until 1982, initially as The K.G. Murray Publishing Company, later named as Murray Publishers Pty Ltd.
name: Kenneth Murray

deck: An actress who portrays a young Mystique in the X-Men film series.
description:
Biography

Jennifer Lawrence was born in Louisville, Kentucky, USA. From a young age she acted in local theater and went on to find an agent in New York City. Her break-out role was in The Bill Engvall Show as Lauren Pearson and later starred in films such as X-Men: First Class, The Hunger Games, and Silver Linings Playbook.

Her fame is increasing thanks to her Oscar winning performance and appearances in popular movies.

Acting Profile

She has a range of acting skills and has had well received roles in action and dramatic films.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Mystique

Jennifer Lawrence played the part of Mystique in X-Men: First Class taking over the role from Rebecca Romijn who played her in the previous films in the franchise. She also appears in X-Men: Days of Future Past in the same role, where she is seen slowly starting to progress in a more darker and coldblooded path. Lawrence is also reportedly set to appear in the upcoming X-Men: Apocalypse film, set to be released in 2016.

Awards

2011X-Men: First ClassPeople's Choice Award for Favorite Movie SuperheroNominated

Biography

Emma Stone was born in Scottsdale, Arizona, USA. While growing up, she was a member of a theater in Phoenix, Arizona. She appeared in 17 shows from the young age of 11. At 15 she dropped out of school and moved to Los Angeles. She was home schooled so she could audition during the day. Her debut performance was in Superbad and this has lead to a successful and popular career in acting.

Biography

deck: An actor who has so far portrayed five comic book characters in live movie and animation, including the latest version of Captain America!
description:
Biography

Born Christopher Robert Evans, American actor Chris Evans, from Boston, Massachussets, began his on-screen acting career in 2000. But it wasn't until 2005 until he gave his first true breakthrough performance in Marvel's Fantastic Four movie.

He has so far portrayed four comic book heroes and one villain, meaning that collectively he has performed in seven comic book feature film adaptations and has several more Captain America and Avengers sequels in the pipelines.

Comic Related Roles

Johnny Storm aka The Human Torch

In 2005's film adaptation of Marvel's Fantastic Four, Fantastic Four: The Movie, Chris Evans portrayed Johnny Storm, fellow astronaut to Reed Richards, Dr Victor Von Doom, Ben Grimm and his sister Susan Storm. When a freak accident sees them return to Earth unaware that they each have been given strange abilities of sorts, they each come to terms in their own way, especially Doom who has literally let his lethal new powers (and his quest for greatness) go to his head. The film culminates in a battle between the aptly named Fantastic Four and Dr Doom. The film appeared to appeal to movie fans but also received mixed reviews and much criticism from purist fans of the classic Marvel series. Regardless, the film was successful enough to be granted a sequel, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer, and Evans also provided voice talent for a video game based on the movie (which was terrible, as most rushed transmedia cash-in games tend to be).

Casey Jones (TMNT)

In 2007, Evans joined the voice talent cast for the 3D animated feature length movie of TMNT (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles) as the voice of vigilante hockey enthusiast Casey Jones.

Based on the original characters as created by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird for IDW Publishing, this version of the Ninja Turtle movie saga carries on after the third and final movie instalment of the early 90's and sees the Turtles become aimless after the defeat of their ultimate nemesis The Shredder.

In this instalment, Casey Jones is now the boyfriend and business partner of April O'Neil. The film has gone on to receive warm reviews over time but only made a profit of just over $20,000,000 at the box ofice upon release. Still not bad considering it took only approximately $32,000,000 to make and distribute!

Cpt. Jake Jensen (The Losers)

In 2010, Chris Evans then went on to portray Captain Jake Jensen, mouthy computer hacker member of 'The Losers.' The Losers was a team created for the Vertigo imprint of DC Comics by writer Andy Diggle and artist Jock. Loosely based on the original WWII version of the same name, this new team, created in 2003 and ending their run in 2009, are a crack Special Forces Unit betrayed by a rogue CIA agent who decide to take revenge against their former employers!

Lucas Lee (an Evil Ex)

In the same year as The Losers, Evans also applied his comedic talents to auteur director Edgar Wright's adaptation of Oni Press graphic novel series 'Scott Pilgrim' about the titular character that must win the right to date the target of his affections (Ramona Flowers) from each of her Seven Evil Exes.

Evans played Lucas Lee, the egotistical action movie star and avid snowboarder. In his scenes, he beats the tar out of Pilgrim, then has his stunt doubles take over for him while he stops for coffee before being goaded into partaking in a frankly suicidal snowboarding stunt for Pilgrim's right to date Ramona.

Scott Pilgrim vs The World was a box office success and is also enjoying a large cult status, especially now that Edgar Wright has been contracted to direct Ant Man as part of Marvel's "Phase 2" of their movie projects!

Steve Rogers aka Captain America

In 2011 and then 2012, Evans became Marvel's golden boy, signing up to play Steve Rogers in Marvel's WWII-based comic action fantasy 'Captain America: The First Avenger' and following that up with his initiation into 'The Avengers'.

Both movies were critical successes that have cemented Evans success as a lead actor and made him a household name with both movie fans and readers of Marvel's comics.

The Captain America movie is a fast-paced origin-tale of how weakling soldier wannabe Steve Rogers signs up for the Super Soldier Program so that he might join the US Army and heroically fight for his country. His efforts lead him up against The Red Skull and HYDRA where he discovers the ultimate plan to conquer and destroy the Allies. With the help of Bucky Barnes, Peggy Carter and Dum-Dum Dugan, he fights to defeat the Red Skull and save the world!

In 'Avengers' otherwise titled Avengers Assemble in the UK, Captain America has been frozen in time and reanimated into the modern world where Loki, brother of Thor, has stoled the Tesseract from SHIELD and wants to apply it to his plans for world dominance. Cap must put aside his differences with the rest of Earth's Mightiest Heroes - Iron Man, Thor, Hulk - and with the help of SHIELD, Nick Fury, Black Widow and Hawkeye, prevent a war of worlds. Though it may be that they will end up having to "avenge" Earth's destruction at the hands of the awaiting alien threat. Avengers broke box office records and just like Captain America beforehand, a sequel or sequel(s) are already in the pipeline thanks to writer and director Joss Whedon!
name: Chris Evans

deck: Actor, producer, director and comic creator
description:
Biography

Michael Chiklis is a producer, director and actor, most notably playing characters in numerous crime dramas. He also starred as Jim Powell in the television series No Ordinary Family, a family of superpowered humans. As Jim Powell, he possessed super strength and invulnerability, with similar powers to a Golden Age Superman, being able to jump tall buildings.

Michael is also the creator of the comic series Pantheon.

Comic Related Roles

Thing

Michael played Ben Grimm, the ever-lovin' blue eyed Thing in the film adaptions of the Fantastic Four. This includes 2005's Fantastic Four and 2007's Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer.
name: Michael Chiklis

deck: Pete Knifton is a British artist
name: Peter Knifton

deck: British born movie and television actor.
description:
Biography

Born in Northern Ireland on the 25th of May in 1964, Ray Stevenson would graduate from Bristol Old Vic Theatre School in 1993, at age 29.

Acting Profile

A British film and television actor Stevenson has played many supporting roles in various movies and television shows, but also headlined and starred as Titus Pullo in the BBC and HBO show Rome.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Volstagg

Ray Stevenson portrays Warriors Three large man Volstagg in Thor (2011) and Thor: the Dark World. Stevenson would require a the use of a 'fat suit' for the role, in order to play the famously rotund character, Volstagg known as much for his girth as well as anything. Stevenson speaking of the experience "I've tried the suit on, and what they've done is kind of sex him up: he's sort of slimmer but rounder, he's got every bit of that Falstaffian verve and vigor, and a bit of a beer gut to suggest that enormous appetite, but he's not the sort of Weeble-shaped figure he is in the comics. He's Falstaff with muscles. I've got this amazing foam-injected undersuit that flexes with me"

The Punisher

Stevenson stars as the protagonist and lead character Frank Castle aka the Punisher in 2008's Punisher: War Zone.

Firefly

Stevenson portrays the mercenary Firefly in 2013's G.I. Joe: Retaliation.
name: Ray Stevenson

deck: American actress whose movie credits include Kick Ass and its sequel.
description:
Biography

Born in California in the United States of America on January 7, 1987.

Acting Profile

Fonseca has a variety of small roles in television and movies, such as the film Hot Tub Time Machine and television shows such as House, and Heroes, but also large roles in shows such as a starring role in Nikita.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Katie Deauxma

Fonseca plays the role of Katie Deauxma in Kick-Ass (2010) and Kick-Ass 2 (2013).
name: Lyndsy Fonseca
